page.title: 09Parish clerk,Marchwood
page.content: The {Parish clerk} is not elected like the parish councillors.She does her job as a paid employee.In many ways, she runs the village.She acts as secretary at all the parish meetings.If local people write to her with complaints like the smell from the incinerator or the sewage works,it is her job to write to the appropriate authority to persuade them to do something about it. Also she has to keep the parish accounts up to date and make sure they are kept as accurately as possible. If any decisions are made by the parish council, it is the clerk's job to make sure that they are carried out. If anyone wants to build anything in Marchwood,permission has to be sought,and it is the clerk's job to check that everything is done properly
